id.title: Id
id.description: The id of this node

org.apache.camel.model.InterceptDefiniti.title: Intercept
org.apache.camel.model.InterceptDefiniti.description: Intercepts a message at each step in the route

description.title: Description
description.description: Sets the description of this node

disabled.title: Disabled
disabled.description: Whether to disable this EIP from the route during build time. Once an EIP has been disabled then it cannot be enabled later at runtime.

id.title: Id
id.description: Sets the id of this node

description.title: Description
description.description: Sets the description of this node

disabled.title: Disabled
disabled.description: Whether to disable this EIP from the route during build time. Once an EIP has been disabled then it cannot be enabled later at runtime.

id.title: Id
id.description: Sets the id of this node

uri.title: Uri
uri.description: Intercept incoming messages from the uri or uri pattern. If this option is not configured, then all incoming messages is intercepted.

org.apache.camel.model.InterceptSendToEn.title: Intercept Send To Endpoint
org.apache.camel.model.InterceptSendToEn.description: Intercepts messages being sent to an endpoint

afterUri.title: After Uri
afterUri.description: After sending to the endpoint then send the message to this uri which allows to process its result.

description.title: Description
description.description: Sets the description of this node

disabled.title: Disabled
disabled.description: Whether to disable this EIP from the route during build time. Once an EIP has been disabled then it cannot be enabled later at runtime.

id.title: Id
id.description: Sets the id of this node

skipSendToOriginalEndpoint.title: Skip Send To Original Endpoint
skipSendToOriginalEndpoint.description: If set to true then the message is not sent to the original endpoint. By default (false) the message is both intercepted and then sent to the original endpoint.

uri.title: Uri
uri.description: Intercept sending to the uri or uri pattern.

org.apache.camel.model.OnCompletionDefin.title: On Completion
org.apache.camel.model.OnCompletionDefin.description: Route to be executed when normal route processing completes

description.title: Description
description.description: Sets the description of this node

disabled.title: Disabled
disabled.description: Whether to disable this EIP from the route during build time. Once an EIP has been disabled then it cannot be enabled later at runtime.

executorService.title: Executor Service
executorService.description: To use a custom Thread Pool to be used for parallel processing. Notice if you set this option, then parallel processing is automatic implied, and you do not have to enable that option as well.

id.title: Id
id.description: Sets the id of this node

mode.title: Mode
mode.description: Sets the on completion mode. The default value is AfterConsumer

onCompleteOnly.title: On Complete Only
onCompleteOnly.description: Will only synchronize when the org.apache.camel.Exchange completed successfully (no errors).

onFailureOnly.title: On Failure Only
onFailureOnly.description: Will only synchronize when the org.apache.camel.Exchange ended with failure (exception or FAULT message).

onWhen.title: On When
onWhen.description: Sets an additional predicate that should be true before the onCompletion is triggered. To be used for fine grained controlling whether a completion callback should be invoked or not

parallelProcessing.title: Parallel Processing
parallelProcessing.description: If enabled then the on completion process will run asynchronously by a separate thread from a thread pool. By default this is false, meaning the on completion process will run synchronously using the same caller thread as from the route.

useOriginalMessage.title: Use Original Message
useOriginalMessage.description: Will use the original input message body when an org.apache.camel.Exchange for this on completion. The original input message is defensively copied, and the copied message body is converted to org.apache.camel.StreamCache if possible (stream caching is enabled, can be disabled globally or on the original route), to ensure the body can be read when the original message is being used later. If the body is converted to org.apache.camel.StreamCache then the message body on the current org.apache.camel.Exchange is replaced with the org.apache.camel.StreamCache body. If the body is not converted to org.apache.camel.StreamCache then the body will not be able to re-read when accessed later. Important: The original input means the input message that are bounded by the current org.apache.camel.spi.UnitOfWork . An unit of work typically spans one route, or multiple routes if they are connected using internal endpoints such as direct or seda. When messages is passed via external endpoints such as JMS or HTTP then the consumer will create a new unit of work, with the message it received as input as the original input. Also some EIP patterns such as splitter, multicast, will create a new unit of work boundary for the messages in their sub-route (eg the split message); however these EIPs have an option named shareUnitOfWork which allows to combine with the parent unit of work in regard to error handling and therefore use the parent original message. By default this feature is off.

org.apache.camel.model.OnExceptionDefini.title: On Exception
org.apache.camel.model.OnExceptionDefini.description: Route to be executed when an exception is thrown

continued.title: Continued
continued.description: Sets whether the exchange should handle and continue routing from the point of failure. If this option is enabled then its considered handled as well.

description.title: Description
description.description: Sets the description of this node

disabled.title: Disabled
disabled.description: Whether to disable this EIP from the route during build time. Once an EIP has been disabled then it cannot be enabled later at runtime.

exception.title: Exception
exception.description: A set of exceptions to react upon.

handled.title: Handled
handled.description: Sets whether the exchange should be marked as handled or not.

id.title: Id
id.description: Sets the id of this node

onExceptionOccurredRef.title: On Exception Occurred Ref
onExceptionOccurredRef.description: Sets a reference to a processor that should be processed just after an exception occurred. Can be used to perform custom logging about the occurred exception at the exact time it happened. Important: Any exception thrown from this processor will be ignored.

onRedeliveryRef.title: On Redelivery Ref
onRedeliveryRef.description: Sets a reference to a processor that should be processed before a redelivery attempt. Can be used to change the org.apache.camel.Exchange before its being redelivered.

onWhen.title: On When
onWhen.description: Sets an additional predicate that should be true before the onException is triggered. To be used for fine grained controlling whether a thrown exception should be intercepted by this exception type or not.

redeliveryPolicyRef.title: Redelivery Policy Ref
redeliveryPolicyRef.description: Sets a reference to a redelivery policy to lookup in the org.apache.camel.spi.Registry to be used.

retryWhile.title: Retry While
retryWhile.description: Sets the retry while predicate. Will continue retrying until predicate returns false.

useOriginalBody.title: Use Original Body
useOriginalBody.description: Will use the original input org.apache.camel.Message body (original body only) when an org.apache.camel.Exchange is moved to the dead letter queue. Notice: this only applies when all redeliveries attempt have failed and the org.apache.camel.Exchange is doomed for failure. Instead of using the current inprogress org.apache.camel.Exchange IN message we use the original IN message instead. This allows you to store the original input in the dead letter queue instead of the inprogress snapshot of the IN message. For instance if you route transform the IN body during routing and then failed. With the original exchange store in the dead letter queue it might be easier to manually re submit the org.apache.camel.Exchange again as the IN message is the same as when Camel received it. So you should be able to send the org.apache.camel.Exchange to the same input. The difference between useOriginalMessage and useOriginalBody is that the former includes both the original body and headers, where as the latter only includes the original body. You can use the latter to enrich the message with custom headers and include the original message body. The former wont let you do this, as its using the original message body and headers as they are. You cannot enable both useOriginalMessage and useOriginalBody. The original input message is defensively copied, and the copied message body is converted to org.apache.camel.StreamCache if possible (stream caching is enabled, can be disabled globally or on the original route), to ensure the body can be read when the original message is being used later. If the body is converted to org.apache.camel.StreamCache then the message body on the current org.apache.camel.Exchange is replaced with the org.apache.camel.StreamCache body. If the body is not converted to org.apache.camel.StreamCache then the body will not be able to re-read when accessed later. Important: The original input means the input message that are bounded by the current org.apache.camel.spi.UnitOfWork . An unit of work typically spans one route, or multiple routes if they are connected using internal endpoints such as direct or seda. When messages is passed via external endpoints such as JMS or HTTP then the consumer will create a new unit of work, with the message it received as input as the original input. Also some EIP patterns such as splitter, multicast, will create a new unit of work boundary for the messages in their sub-route (eg the split message); however these EIPs have an option named shareUnitOfWork which allows to combine with the parent unit of work in regard to error handling and therefore use the parent original message. By default this feature is off.

Notice: this only applies when all redeliveries attempt have failed and the org.apache.camel.Exchange is doomed for failure. So you should be able to send the org.apache.camel.Exchange to the same input. You can use the latter to enrich the message with custom headers and include the original message body. The former wont let you do this, as its using the original message body and headers as they are. You cannot enable both useOriginalMessage and useOriginalBody. The original input message is defensively copied, and the copied message body is converted to org.apache.camel.StreamCache if possible (stream caching is enabled, can be disabled globally or on the original route), to ensure the body can be read when the original message is being used later. If the body is converted to org.apache.camel.StreamCache then the message body on the current org.apache.camel.Exchange is replaced with the org.apache.camel.StreamCache body. If the body is not converted to org.apache.camel.StreamCache then the body will not be able to re-read when accessed later. Important: The original input means the input message that are bounded by the current org.apache.camel.spi.UnitOfWork . An unit of work typically spans one route, or multiple routes if they are connected using internal endpoints such as direct or seda. When messages is passed via external endpoints such as JMS or HTTP then the consumer will create a new unit of work, with the message it received as input as the original input. Also some EIP patterns such as splitter, multicast, will create a new unit of work boundary for the messages in their sub-route (eg the split message); however these EIPs have an option named shareUnitOfWork which allows to combine with the parent unit of work in regard to error handling and therefore use the parent original message. By default this feature is off.

org.apache.camel.model.errorhandler.Dead.title: Dead Letter Channel
org.apache.camel.model.errorhandler.Dead.description: Error handler with dead letter queue.

deadLetterHandleNewException.title: Dead Letter Handle New Exception
deadLetterHandleNewException.description: Whether the dead letter channel should handle (and ignore) any new exception that may been thrown during sending the message to the dead letter endpoint. The default value is true which means any such kind of exception is handled and ignored. Set this to false to let the exception be propagated back on the org.apache.camel.Exchange . This can be used in situations where you use transactions, and want to use Camel's dead letter channel to deal with exceptions during routing, but if the dead letter channel itself fails because of a new exception being thrown, then by setting this to false the new exceptions is propagated back and set on the org.apache.camel.Exchange , which allows the transaction to detect the exception, and rollback.

deadLetterUri.title: Dead Letter Uri
deadLetterUri.description: The dead letter endpoint uri for the Dead Letter error handler.

executorServiceRef.title: Executor Service Ref
executorServiceRef.description: Sets a reference to a thread pool to be used by the error handler

id.title: Id
id.description: The id of this node

level.title: Level
level.description: Logging level to use by error handler

logName.title: Log Name
logName.description: Name of the logger to use by the error handler

loggerRef.title: Logger Ref
loggerRef.description: References to a logger to use as logger for the error handler

onExceptionOccurredRef.title: On Exception Occurred Ref
onExceptionOccurredRef.description: Sets a reference to a processor that should be processed just after an exception occurred. Can be used to perform custom logging about the occurred exception at the exact time it happened. Important: Any exception thrown from this processor will be ignored.

onPrepareFailureRef.title: On Prepare Failure Ref
onPrepareFailureRef.description: Sets a reference to a processor to prepare the org.apache.camel.Exchange before handled by the failure processor / dead letter channel. This allows for example to enrich the message before sending to a dead letter queue.

onRedeliveryRef.title: On Redelivery Ref
onRedeliveryRef.description: Sets a reference to a processor that should be processed before a redelivery attempt. Can be used to change the org.apache.camel.Exchange before its being redelivered.

redeliveryPolicyRef.title: Redelivery Policy Ref
redeliveryPolicyRef.description: Sets a reference to a RedeliveryPolicy to be used for redelivery settings.

retryWhileRef.title: Retry While Ref
retryWhileRef.description: Sets a retry while predicate. Will continue retrying until the predicate evaluates to false.

rollbackLoggingLevel.title: Rollback Logging Level

transactedPolicyRef.title: Transacted Policy Ref
transactedPolicyRef.description: The transacted policy to use that is configured for either Spring or JTA based transactions. If no policy has been configured then Camel will attempt to auto-discover.

The difference between useOriginalMessage and useOriginalBody is that the former includes both the original body and headers, where as the latter only includes the original body. You can use the latter to enrich the message with custom headers and include the original message body. The former wont let you do this, as its using the original message body and headers as they are. You cannot enable both useOriginalMessage and useOriginalBody. The original input message is defensively copied, and the copied message body is converted to org.apache.camel.StreamCache if possible (stream caching is enabled, can be disabled globally or on the original route), to ensure the body can be read when the original message is being used later. If the body is converted to org.apache.camel.StreamCache then the message body on the current org.apache.camel.Exchange is replaced with the org.apache.camel.StreamCache body. If the body is not converted to org.apache.camel.StreamCache then the body will not be able to re-read when accessed later. Important: The original input means the input message that are bounded by the current org.apache.camel.spi.UnitOfWork . An unit of work typically spans one route, or multiple routes if they are connected using internal endpoints such as direct or seda. When messages is passed via external endpoints such as JMS or HTTP then the consumer will create a new unit of work, with the message it received as input as the original input. Also some EIP patterns such as splitter, multicast, will create a new unit of work boundary for the messages in their sub-route (eg the splitted message); however these EIPs have an option named shareUnitOfWork which allows to combine with the parent unit of work in regard to error handling and therefore use the parent original message. By default this feature is off.

org.apache.camel.model.errorhandler.NoEr.title: No Error Handler
org.apache.camel.model.errorhandler.NoEr.description: To not use an error handler.

id.title: Id
id.description: The id of this node

org.apache.camel.model.errorhandler.RefE.title: Ref Error Handler
org.apache.camel.model.errorhandler.RefE.description: References to an existing or custom error handler.

id.description: The id of this node

ref.title: Ref
ref.description: References to an existing or custom error handler.

org.apache.camel.model.errorhandler.Spri.title: Spring Transaction Error Handler
org.apache.camel.model.errorhandler.Spri.description: Spring based transactional error handler (requires camel-spring).

executorServiceRef.title: Executor Service Ref
executorServiceRef.description: Sets a reference to a thread pool to be used by the error handler

id.title: Id
id.description: The id of this node

level.title: Level
level.description: Logging level to use by error handler

logName.title: Log Name
logName.description: Name of the logger to use by the error handler

loggerRef.title: Logger Ref
loggerRef.description: References to a logger to use as logger for the error handler

onExceptionOccurredRef.title: On Exception Occurred Ref
onExceptionOccurredRef.description: Sets a reference to a processor that should be processed just after an exception occurred. Can be used to perform custom logging about the occurred exception at the exact time it happened. Important: Any exception thrown from this processor will be ignored.

onPrepareFailureRef.title: On Prepare Failure Ref
onPrepareFailureRef.description: Sets a reference to a processor to prepare the org.apache.camel.Exchange before handled by the failure processor / dead letter channel. This allows for example to enrich the message before sending to a dead letter queue.

onRedeliveryRef.title: On Redelivery Ref
onRedeliveryRef.description: Sets a reference to a processor that should be processed before a redelivery attempt. Can be used to change the org.apache.camel.Exchange before its being redelivered.

redeliveryPolicyRef.title: Redelivery Policy Ref
redeliveryPolicyRef.description: Sets a reference to a RedeliveryPolicy to be used for redelivery settings.

retryWhileRef.title: Retry While Ref
retryWhileRef.description: Sets a retry while predicate. Will continue retrying until the predicate evaluates to false.

rollbackLoggingLevel.title: Rollback Logging Level
rollbackLoggingLevel.description: Sets the logging level to use for logging transactional rollback. This option is default WARN.

transactedPolicyRef.title: Transacted Policy Ref
transactedPolicyRef.description: The transacted policy to use that is configured for either Spring or JTA based transactions. If no policy has been configured then Camel will attempt to auto-discover.

useOriginalBody.title: Use Original Body
useOriginalBody.description: Will use the original input org.apache.camel.Message body (original body only) when an org.apache.camel.Exchange is moved to the dead letter queue. Notice: this only applies when all redeliveries attempt have failed and the org.apache.camel.Exchange is doomed for failure. Instead of using the current inprogress org.apache.camel.Exchange IN message we use the original IN message instead. This allows you to store the original input in the dead letter queue instead of the inprogress snapshot of the IN message. For instance if you route transform the IN body during routing and then failed. With the original exchange store in the dead letter queue it might be easier to manually re submit the org.apache.camel.Exchange again as the IN message is the same as when Camel received it. So you should be able to send the org.apache.camel.Exchange to the same input. The difference between useOriginalMessage and useOriginalBody is that the former includes both the original body and headers, where as the latter only includes the original body. You can use the latter to enrich the message with custom headers and include the original message body. The former wont let you do this, as its using the original message body and headers as they are. You cannot enable both useOriginalMessage and useOriginalBody. The original input message is defensively copied, and the copied message body is converted to org.apache.camel.StreamCache if possible (stream caching is enabled, can be disabled globally or on the original route), to ensure the body can be read when the original message is being used later. If the body is converted to org.apache.camel.StreamCache then the message body on the current org.apache.camel.Exchange is replaced with the org.apache.camel.StreamCache body. If the body is not converted to org.apache.camel.StreamCache then the body will not be able to re-read when accessed later. Important: The original input means the input message that are bounded by the current org.apache.camel.spi.UnitOfWork . An unit of work typically spans one route, or multiple routes if they are connected using internal endpoints such as direct or seda. When messages is passed via external endpoints such as JMS or HTTP then the consumer will create a new unit of work, with the message it received as input as the original input. Also some EIP patterns such as splitter, multicast, will create a new unit of work boundary for the messages in their sub-route (eg the splitted message); however these EIPs have an option named shareUnitOfWork which allows to combine with the parent unit of work in regard to error handling and therefore use the parent original message. By default this feature is off.

useOriginalMessage.title: Use Original Message
useOriginalMessage.description: Will use the original input org.apache.camel.Message (original body and headers) when an org.apache.camel.Exchange is moved to the dead letter queue. Notice: this only applies when all redeliveries attempt have failed and the org.apache.camel.Exchange is doomed for failure. Instead of using the current inprogress org.apache.camel.Exchange IN message we use the original IN message instead. This allows you to store the original input in the dead letter queue instead of the inprogress snapshot of the IN message. For instance if you route transform the IN body during routing and then failed. With the original exchange store in the dead letter queue it might be easier to manually re submit the org.apache.camel.Exchange again as the IN message is the same as when Camel received it. So you should be able to send the org.apache.camel.Exchange to the same input. The difference between useOriginalMessage and useOriginalBody is that the former includes both the original body and headers, where as the latter only includes the original body. You can use the latter to enrich the message with custom headers and include the original message body. The former wont let you do this, as its using the original message body and headers as they are. You cannot enable both useOriginalMessage and useOriginalBody. The original input message is defensively copied, and the copied message body is converted to org.apache.camel.StreamCache if possible (stream caching is enabled, can be disabled globally or on the original route), to ensure the body can be read when the original message is being used later. If the body is converted to org.apache.camel.StreamCache then the message body on the current org.apache.camel.Exchange is replaced with the org.apache.camel.StreamCache body. If the body is not converted to org.apache.camel.StreamCache then the body will not be able to re-read when accessed later. Important: The original input means the input message that are bounded by the current org.apache.camel.spi.UnitOfWork . An unit of work typically spans one route, or multiple routes if they are connected using internal endpoints such as direct or seda. When messages is passed via external endpoints such as JMS or HTTP then the consumer will create a new unit of work, with the message it received as input as the original input. Also some EIP patterns such as splitter, multicast, will create a new unit of work boundary for the messages in their sub-route (eg the splitted message); however these EIPs have an option named shareUnitOfWork which allows to combine with the parent unit of work in regard to error handling and therefore use the parent original message. By default this feature is off.

org.apache.camel.model.WhenDefinition.title: When
org.apache.camel.model.WhenDefinition.description: Triggers a route when the expression evaluates to true

expression.title: Expression
expression.description: Expression used as the predicate to evaluate whether this when should trigger and route the message or not.

description.title: Description
description.description: Sets the description of this node

disabled.title: Disabled
disabled.description: Whether to disable this EIP from the route during build time. Once an EIP has been disabled then it cannot be enabled later at runtime.

id.title: Id
id.description: Sets the id of this node

org.apache.camel.model.RedeliveryPolicyD.title: Redelivery Policy
org.apache.camel.model.RedeliveryPolicyD.description: To configure re-delivery for error handling

allowRedeliveryWhileStopping.title: Allow Redelivery While Stopping
allowRedeliveryWhileStopping.description: Controls whether to allow redelivery while stopping/shutting down a route that uses error handling.

asyncDelayedRedelivery.title: Async Delayed Redelivery
asyncDelayedRedelivery.description: Allow asynchronous delayed redelivery. The route, in particular the consumer's component, must support the Asynchronous Routing Engine (e.g. seda).

delayPattern.title: Delay Pattern
delayPattern.description: Sets the delay pattern with delay intervals.

disableRedelivery.title: Disable Redelivery
disableRedelivery.description: Disables redelivery (same as setting maximum redeliveries to 0)

exchangeFormatterRef.title: Exchange Formatter Ref
exchangeFormatterRef.description: Sets the reference of the instance of org.apache.camel.spi.ExchangeFormatter to generate the log message from exchange.

id.title: Id
id.description: The id of this node

logContinued.title: Log Continued
logContinued.description: Sets whether continued exceptions should be logged or not. Can be used to include or reduce verbose.

logExhausted.title: Log Exhausted
logExhausted.description: Sets whether exhausted exceptions should be logged or not. Can be used to include or reduce verbose.

logExhaustedMessageBody.title: Log Exhausted Message Body
logExhaustedMessageBody.description: Sets whether exhausted message body should be logged including message history or not (supports property placeholders). Can be used to include or reduce verbose. Requires logExhaustedMessageHistory to be enabled.

logExhaustedMessageHistory.title: Log Exhausted Message History
logExhaustedMessageHistory.description: Sets whether exhausted exceptions should be logged including message history or not (supports property placeholders). Can be used to include or reduce verbose.

logHandled.title: Log Handled
logHandled.description: Sets whether handled exceptions should be logged or not. Can be used to include or reduce verbose.

logNewException.title: Log New Exception
logNewException.description: Sets whether new exceptions should be logged or not. Can be used to include or reduce verbose. A new exception is an exception that was thrown while handling a previous exception.

logRetryAttempted.title: Log Retry Attempted
logRetryAttempted.description: Sets whether retry attempts should be logged or not. Can be used to include or reduce verbose.

logRetryStackTrace.title: Log Retry Stack Trace
logRetryStackTrace.description: Sets whether stack traces should be logged when an retry attempt failed. Can be used to include or reduce verbose.

logStackTrace.title: Log Stack Trace
logStackTrace.description: Sets whether stack traces should be logged. Can be used to include or reduce verbose.

maximumRedeliveries.title: Maximum Redeliveries
maximumRedeliveries.description: Sets the maximum redeliveries x = redeliver at most x times 0 = no redeliveries -1 = redeliver forever

maximumRedeliveryDelay.title: Maximum Redelivery Delay
maximumRedeliveryDelay.description: Sets the maximum delay between redelivery

retriesExhaustedLogLevel.title: Retries Exhausted Log Level
retriesExhaustedLogLevel.description: Sets the logging level to use when retries have been exhausted

retryAttemptedLogInterval.title: Retry Attempted Log Interval
retryAttemptedLogInterval.description: Sets the interval to use for logging retry attempts

retryAttemptedLogLevel.title: Retry Attempted Log Level
retryAttemptedLogLevel.description: Sets the logging level to use for logging retry attempts

suppressExceptions.description: Whether to suppress exceptions such as PathNotFoundException.

unpackArray.description: Whether to unpack a single element json-array into an object.

beanType.title: Bean Type
beanType.description: Class name (fully qualified) of the bean to use Will lookup in registry and if there is a single instance of the same type, then the existing bean is used, otherwise a new bean is created (requires a default no-arg constructor).

id.title: Id
id.description: Sets the id of this node

ref.title: Ref
ref.description: Reference to an existing bean (bean id) to lookup in the registry

resultType.title: Result Type
resultType.description: Sets the class of the result type (type from output)

scope.title: Scope
scope.description: Scope of bean. When using singleton scope (default) the bean is created or looked up only once and reused for the lifetime of the endpoint. The bean should be thread-safe in case concurrent threads is calling the bean at the same time. When using request scope the bean is created or looked up once per request (exchange). This can be used if you want to store state on a bean while processing a request and you want to call the same bean instance multiple times while processing the request. The bean does not have to be thread-safe as the instance is only called from the same request. When using prototype scope, then the bean will be looked up or created per call. However in case of lookup then this is delegated to the bean registry such as Spring or CDI (if in use), which depends on their configuration can act as either singleton or prototype scope. So when using prototype scope then this depends on the bean registry implementation.

org.apache.camel.model.language.Tokenize.title: Tokenize
org.apache.camel.model.language.Tokenize.description: Tokenize text payloads using delimiter patterns.

endToken.title: End Token
endToken.description: The end token to use as tokenizer if using start/end token pairs. You can use simple language as the token to support dynamic tokens.

group.title: Group
group.description: To group N parts together, for example to split big files into chunks of 1000 lines. You can use simple language as the group to support dynamic group sizes.

groupDelimiter.title: Group Delimiter
groupDelimiter.description: Sets the delimiter to use when grouping. If this has not been set then token will be used as the delimiter.

id.title: Id
id.description: Sets the id of this node

includeTokens.title: Include Tokens
includeTokens.description: Whether to include the tokens in the parts when using pairs. When including tokens then the endToken property must also be configured (to use pair mode). The default value is false

inheritNamespaceTagName.title: Inherit Namespace Tag Name
inheritNamespaceTagName.description: To inherit namespaces from a root/parent tag name when using XML You can use simple language as the tag name to support dynamic names.

regex.title: Regex
regex.description: If the token is a regular expression pattern. The default value is false

resultType.title: Result Type
resultType.description: Sets the class of the result type (type from output)

skipFirst.title: Skip First
skipFirst.description: To skip the very first element

source.title: Source
source.description: Source to use, instead of message body. You can prefix with variable:, header:, or property: to specify kind of source. Otherwise, the source is assumed to be a variable. Use empty or null to use default source, which is the message body.

token.title: Token
token.description: The (start) token to use as tokenizer, for example you can use the new line token. You can use simple language as the token to support dynamic tokens.

trim.title: Trim
trim.description: Whether to trim the value to remove leading and trailing whitespaces and line breaks

xml.title: Xml
xml.description: Whether the input is XML messages. This option must be set to true if working with XML payloads.

org.apache.camel.model.language.XPathExp.description: Evaluates an XPath expression against an XML payload.

documentType.description: Name of class for document type The default value is org.w3c.dom.Document

factoryRef.description: References to a custom XPathFactory to lookup in the registry

logNamespaces.title: Log Namespaces
logNamespaces.description: Whether to log namespaces which can assist during troubleshooting

namespace.title: Namespace
namespace.description: Injects the XML Namespaces of prefix - uri mappings

objectModel.title: Object Model
objectModel.description: The XPath object model to use

preCompile.title: Pre Compile
preCompile.description: Whether to enable pre-compiling the xpath expression during initialization phase. pre-compile is enabled by default. This can be used to turn off, for example in cases the compilation phase is desired at the starting phase, such as if the application is ahead of time compiled (for example with camel-quarkus) which would then load the xpath factory of the built operating system, and not a JVM runtime.

resultQName.title: Result QName
resultQName.description: Sets the output type supported by XPath.

resultType.title: Result Type
resultType.description: Sets the class of the result type (type from output)

source.title: Source
source.description: Source to use, instead of message body. You can prefix with variable:, header:, or property: to specify kind of source. Otherwise, the source is assumed to be a variable. Use empty or null to use default source, which is the message body.

threadSafety.title: Thread Safety
threadSafety.description: Whether to enable thread-safety for the returned result of the xpath expression. This applies to when using NODESET as the result type, and the returned set has multiple elements. In this situation there can be thread-safety issues if you process the NODESET concurrently such as from a Camel Splitter EIP in parallel processing mode. This option prevents concurrency issues by doing defensive copies of the nodes. It is recommended to turn this option on if you are using camel-saxon or Saxon in your application. Saxon has thread-safety issues which can be prevented by turning this option on.

trim.title: Trim
trim.description: Whether to trim the value to remove leading and trailing whitespaces and line breaks

org.apache.camel.model.language.XQueryEx.title: XQuery
org.apache.camel.model.language.XQueryEx.description: Evaluates an XQuery expressions against an XML payload.

configurationRef.title: Configuration Ref
configurationRef.description: Reference to a saxon configuration instance in the registry to use for xquery (requires camel-saxon). This may be needed to add custom functions to a saxon configuration, so these custom functions can be used in xquery expressions.

expression.title: Expression
expression.description: The expression value in your chosen language syntax

id.description: Sets the id of this node

namespace.title: Namespace
namespace.description: Injects the XML Namespaces of prefix - uri mappings

resultType.title: Result Type
resultType.description: Sets the class of the result type (type from output)

mode.title: Mode
mode.description: The extraction mode. The available extraction modes are: i - injecting the contextual namespace bindings into the extracted token (default) w - wrapping the extracted token in its ancestor context u - unwrapping the extracted token to its child content t - extracting the text content of the specified element
